### computeTables() {#a6b586580f1e35e04ae0f3186fadd6594}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void LegacyLegalizerInfo::computeTables ()">
Compute any ancillary tables needed to quickly decide how an operation should be handled.

This must be called after all &quot;set&#42;Action&quot;methods but before any query is made or incorrect results may be returned.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-h/#l00148">148</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-h">LegacyLegalizerInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-cpp/#l00105">105</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-cpp">LegacyLegalizerInfo.cpp</a>.

### setLegalizeScalarToDifferentSizeStrategy() {#ac118cc8e04f71fc897c5a84874595eb0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::LegacyLegalizerInfo::setLegalizeScalarToDifferentSizeStrategy (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> unsigned Opcode, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> unsigned TypeIdx, <a href="#a2001432f616b09f569d6147c957948c3">SizeChangeStrategy</a> S)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
The setAction calls record the non-size-changing legalization actions to take on specificly-sized types.

The <a href="#a2001432f616b09f569d6147c957948c3">SizeChangeStrategy</a> defines what to do when the size of the type needs to be changed to reach a legally sized type (i.e., one that was defined through a setAction call). e.g. setAction (&#123;G&#95;ADD, 0, LLT::scalar(32)&#125;, Legal); setLegalizeScalarToDifferentSizeStrategy(
  G&#95;ADD, 0, widenToLargerTypesAndNarrowToLargest); will end up defining getAction(&#123;G&#95;ADD, 0, T&#125;) to return the following actions for different scalar types T: LLT::scalar(1)..LLT::scalar(31): &#123;WidenScalar, 0, LLT::scalar(32)&#125; LLT::scalar(32): &#123;Legal, 0, LLT::scalar(32)&#125; LLT::scalar(33)..: &#123;NarrowScalar, 0, LLT::scalar(32)&#125;

If no SizeChangeAction gets defined, through this function, the default is unsupportedForDifferentSizes.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-h/#l00180">180</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-h">LegacyLegalizerInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::LegacyLegalizerInfo::setLegalizeVectorElementToDifferentSizeStrategy (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> unsigned Opcode, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> unsigned TypeIdx, <a href="#a2001432f616b09f569d6147c957948c3">SizeChangeStrategy</a> S)</>}

### findScalarLegalAction() {#a4f93fb284bb858d62aa5e63f29523521}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::pair&lt; LegacyLegalizeAction, LLT &gt; LegacyLegalizerInfo::findScalarLegalAction (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/instraspect">InstrAspect</a> &amp; Aspect) const</>}>
Returns the next action needed to get the scalar or pointer type closer to being legal E.g.

findLegalAction(&#123;G&#95;REM, 13&#125;) should return (WidenScalar, 32). After that, findLegalAction(&#123;G&#95;REM, 32&#125;) will probably be called, which should return (Lower, 32). This is assuming the setScalarAction on G&#95;REM was something like: setScalarAction(G&#95;REM, 0, &#123;&#123;1, WidenScalar&#125;, // bit sizes &#91; 1, 31&#91; &#123;32, Lower&#125;, // bit sizes &#91;32, 33&#91; &#123;33, NarrowScalar&#125; // bit sizes &#91;65, +inf&#91; &#125;);

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-h/#l00437">437</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-h">LegacyLegalizerInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-cpp/#l00303">303</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-cpp">LegacyLegalizerInfo.cpp</a>.

### setScalarAction() {#a27503e2fc0aa8b6c7bf260542a991787}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::LegacyLegalizerInfo::setScalarAction (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> unsigned Opcode, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> unsigned TypeIndex, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="#a703c0ed452aea3693d8fe1441a935d5a">SizeAndActionsVec</a> &amp; SizeAndActions)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
The <a href="#a703c0ed452aea3693d8fe1441a935d5a">SizeAndActionsVec</a> is a representation mapping between all natural numbers and an Action.

The natural number represents the bit size of the <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/instraspect">InstrAspect</a>. For example, for a target with native support for 32-bit and 64-bit additions, you&#39;d express that as: setScalarAction(G&#95;ADD, 0, &#123;&#123;1, WidenScalar&#125;, // bit sizes &#91; 1, 31&#91; &#123;32, Legal&#125;, // bit sizes &#91;32, 33&#91; &#123;33, WidenScalar&#125;, // bit sizes &#91;33, 64&#91; &#123;64, Legal&#125;, // bit sizes &#91;64, 65&#91; &#123;65, NarrowScalar&#125; // bit sizes &#91;65, +inf&#91; &#125;); It may be that only 64-bit pointers are supported on your target: setPointerAction(G&#95;PTR&#95;ADD, 0, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a>:pointer(1), &#123;&#123;1, Unsupported&#125;, // bit sizes &#91; 1, 63&#91; &#123;64, Legal&#125;, // bit sizes &#91;64, 65&#91; &#123;65, Unsupported&#125;, // bit sizes &#91;65, +inf&#91; &#125;);

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-h/#l00311">311</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-h">LegacyLegalizerInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setScalarInVectorAction() {#a8f5972b51d9da92512cabe79063c137a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::LegacyLegalizerInfo::setScalarInVectorAction (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> unsigned Opcode, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> unsigned TypeIndex, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="#a703c0ed452aea3693d8fe1441a935d5a">SizeAndActionsVec</a> &amp; SizeAndActions)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
If an operation on a given vector type (say &lt;M x iN&gt;) isn&#39;t explicitly specified, we proceed in 2 stages.

First we legalize the underlying scalar (so that there&#39;s at least one legal vector with that scalar), then we adjust the number of elements in the vector so that it is legal. The desired action in the first step is controlled by this function.

### increaseToLargerTypesAndDecreaseToLargest() {#aee07c139c35f051d5306d1c6823dbf0c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LegacyLegalizerInfo::SizeAndActionsVec LegacyLegalizerInfo::increaseToLargerTypesAndDecreaseToLargest (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="#a703c0ed452aea3693d8fe1441a935d5a">SizeAndActionsVec</a> &amp; v, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/legacylegalizeactions/#ad25716c86372dafbf624b34891685078">LegacyLegalizeActions::LegacyLegalizeAction</a> IncreaseAction, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/legacylegalizeactions/#ad25716c86372dafbf624b34891685078">LegacyLegalizeActions::LegacyLegalizeAction</a> DecreaseAction)</>}

### moreToWiderTypesAndLessToWidest() {#a619f20a86e6a67eb6ff2b3bd2dd8d67e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static SizeAndActionsVec llvm::LegacyLegalizerInfo::moreToWiderTypesAndLessToWidest (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="#a703c0ed452aea3693d8fe1441a935d5a">SizeAndActionsVec</a> &amp; v)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
A <a href="#a2001432f616b09f569d6147c957948c3">SizeChangeStrategy</a> for the common case where legalization for a particular vector operation consists of having more elements in the vector, to a type that is legal.

Unless there is no such type and then instead it should be legalized towards the widest vector that&#39;s still legal. E.g. setAction(&#123;G&#95;ADD, LLT::vector(8, 8)&#125;, Legal); setAction(&#123;G&#95;ADD, LLT::vector(16, 8)&#125;, Legal); setAction(&#123;G&#95;ADD, LLT::vector(2, 32)&#125;, Legal); setAction(&#123;G&#95;ADD, LLT::vector(4, 32)&#125;, Legal); setLegalizeVectorElementToDifferentSizeStrategy(
    G&#95;ADD, 0, moreToWiderTypesAndLessToWidest); will result in the following getAction results:
<ul>
<li>getAction(&#123;G&#95;ADD, LLT::vector(8,8)&#125;) returns (Legal, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpupromotealloca-cpp/#ac760e37eba1d852d0a28011a1a0ce05f">vector(8,8)</a>).</li>
<li>getAction(&#123;G&#95;ADD, LLT::vector(9,8)&#125;) returns (MoreElements, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpupromotealloca-cpp/#ac760e37eba1d852d0a28011a1a0ce05f">vector(16,8)</a>).</li>
<li>getAction(&#123;G&#95;ADD, LLT::vector(8,32)&#125;) returns (FewerElements, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpupromotealloca-cpp/#ac760e37eba1d852d0a28011a1a0ce05f">vector(4,32)</a>).</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-h/#l00263">263</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-h">LegacyLegalizerInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### unsupportedForDifferentSizes() {#aebb0c4b04132fb5bad2a70b2854a1b83}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static SizeAndActionsVec llvm::LegacyLegalizerInfo::unsupportedForDifferentSizes (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="#a703c0ed452aea3693d8fe1441a935d5a">SizeAndActionsVec</a> &amp; v)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
A <a href="#a2001432f616b09f569d6147c957948c3">SizeChangeStrategy</a> for the common case where legalization for a particular operation consists of only supporting a specific set of type sizes.

E.g. setAction (&#123;G&#95;DIV, 0, LLT::scalar(32)&#125;, Legal); setAction (&#123;G&#95;DIV, 0, LLT::scalar(64)&#125;, Legal); setLegalizeScalarToDifferentSizeStrategy(
    G&#95;DIV, 0, unsupportedForDifferentSizes); will result in getAction(&#123;G&#95;DIV, 0, T&#125;) to return Legal for s32 and s64, and Unsupported for all other scalar types T.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-h/#l00210">210</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/legacylegalizerinfo-h">LegacyLegalizerInfo.h</a>.
